title: Gaspare Spontini
subtitle: An 18th century Italian composer
description:
The folThe following story will explore the WikiData knowledge base to discover the most significant points and events in the Italian composer Gaspare Spontini’s personal and professional life.
We will start with a general exploration of the WikiData knowledge base to discover the quantity of people and artists in comparison with MusicBO and then we will narrow down our research analysing composers in WikiData, until finding our main object of the story: Gaspare Spontini.  
In particular, we will focus on his biography, his occupations and fields of work, the awards he received during his life, where he worked and the cities where he lived. There will be at the end an insight on the Museum Gaspare Spontini, its location and the visitors he had per year.

At this point, we searched a composer who was both in the Polifonia corpus and had lots of data on Wikidata, and we chose GASPARE SPONTINI.

Here it is an example of context from MusicBO:

“[...] a few of the chorus gathered in a semicircle around Spontini, in order to have a look at that remarkable man, as he held forth with wonderful effect on the requirements of true theatrical art.”

dynamic_elements.table_title: Gaspare Spontini, portrayed by Jean-Baptiste Aubry-Lecomte in the 19th century.

dynamic_elements.text: He was born in 1774 in Maiolati, which was at the time in the Papal State, now in the Province of Ancona. During his life, he spent most of his career abroad. He then returned to Italy and died in 1851 in Maiolati.
